title: Instructional Design Decision-Making Strategies Under Organizational Anarchy

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of decision-making processes within organizations, foundational instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Program strengthening instructional design decision-making competencies for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to solve complex organizational problems in asynchronous settings.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the characteristics of organizational anarchy (public institutions) and explain their impact on instructional design decision-making.
Learners can evaluate decision-making patterns in complex organizational environments using literature analysis methods.
Learners can propose effective instructional design solutions under organizational constraints through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
